p: Extreme temperatures are typically the deadliest weather and climate hazard, particularly in the United States. Heat accounts for significant health risks, mortality, and morbidity and also creates challenges for energy, ecological, energy and technological systems. As greenhouse gas‐driven climate change continues to warm the atmosphere, residents of urban environments will experience a triple threat: a mean warmer climate system, more intense and/or frequent heatwaves, and the UHI.
